metadata.Title: CVE-2014-8500 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
ISC BIND 9.0.x through 9.8.x, 9.9.0 through 9.9.6, and 9.10.0 through9.10.1 does not limit delegation chaining, which allows remote attackers tocause a denial of service (memory consumption and named crash) via a largeor infinite number of referrals.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-8500` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

bind9 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
bind9-host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
bind9utils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
dnsutils - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
host - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
libbind9-90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
libdns100 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
libisc95 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
libisccc90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
libisccfg90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
liblwres90 - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
lwresd - 1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: bind9 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:9.9.5.dfsg-3ubuntu0.1').
